page.title: 02TRANSPORT
page.content:
Transport and communication in our area is served by road and rail.
The railway,part of the old G.W.R. ,is now used only for mineral working and heavy goods to Roseheyworth Colliery.
The main road link is the A467 Newport_Brynmawr trunk route.This follows the lower eastern side of the valley and passes through Abertillery.
The valley is served by the National Welsh bus company and by the local firm of Henleys',which runs buses to Cwmtillery,Blaenau Gwent and Brynithel.The area also has several coach hire firms and three taxi services. Lorries deliver the majority of goods while most families have a car as the most convenient method of travel.
